name: Veitch's Masdevallia
description: Masdevallia veitchiana, commonly known as Veitch's Masdevallia or King of the Masdevallias, is an epiphytic orchid native to the cloud forests of Peru and Ecuador in South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features small, compact growth with narrow, dark green leaves (8-15 cm long) arranged in a fan-like pattern. The plant produces distinctive triangular flowers with elongated tails or "ears" that are bright orange to red-orange with yellow markings. Many Masdevallia species produce flowers in unusual colors (orange, red, yellow, purple) and have fuzzy or hairy textures that make them look otherworldly. The plant displays an upright, compact growth habit and typically reaches 8-15 cm in height. In its native cloud forest habitat, it grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks and branches in cool, humid, high-altitude environments. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds unique floral displays with its bizarre, often fuzzy flowers. It's popular among orchid enthusiasts for its distinctive appearance.
careTips: Requires very high humidity (70-90%) - ideal for closed terrariums
Prefers cooler temperatures (15-24°C) - avoid temperatures above 27°C
Never let dry completely - keep consistently moist but not waterlogged
Excellent for closed terrariums where humidity can be maintained
Native to cloud forests of Peru and Ecuador - prefers cool, humid conditions
Low to medium light is best - bright indirect light, avoid direct sun
Epiphytic/mounted culture preferred - can be grown in sphagnum moss or fine orchid mix
Water when substrate begins to dry - typically 2-3 times per week
Feed monthly with diluted orchid fertilizer (quarter strength) during growing season
Can be grown in terrariums with high humidity or specialized orchid setups
Watch for root rot if kept too wet - ensure good drainage
Flowers are distinctive with triangular shape and elongated tails
